title: [Large-Scale] Online Language Message Design Learning Through Mobile Microblogging

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental message design principles and experience with online educational tools, elementary-level grammar structures and vocabulary application skills
context.additional_context: Aims to improve practicing elementary teachers’ ability to design practical language messages applicable to their work. Emphasizes daily learning activities using mobile devices. Focuses on mastering techniques to optimize teacher messages for improving students’ reading comprehension.

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three principles of language message design (clarity, conciseness, empathy) based on real text examples collected from everyday contexts.
Learners can analyze and critique peers’ case studies on mobile microblogging platforms, evaluate vocabulary choices and expression methods, and incorporate insights into their own designs.
Learners can improve their language message design artifacts by over 80% based on synthesized peer feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
